intro: Parrya linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parrya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Parrya linearifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
